intro: Erigeron telekii, commonly known as the Hungarian fleabane, is a flowering plant native to Hungary and parts of Central Europe. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and grasslands. It produces small, white to pale blue flowers that bloom in late summer to early autumn. Erigeron telekii is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its delicate appearance.
